stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Watering Hole Attacks Involving Forum Websites
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On or around 16 September 2014, watering hole attacks involving forum websites compromised three U.S. Government agency hosts by exploiting Silverlight and Flash vulnerabilities. The systems were redirected to domains that all resolved to 64.202.116.152.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: The three systems each visited compromised websites, where they were redirected to other websites and then compromised. All three hosts were redirected to websites that resolved to IP address 64.202.116.152.

The first compromised host was redirected to this site while visiting the web forum http://forum.freeadvice.com/otherreal-estate-law-questions-11/multiple-owners-deed-can-one-force-sale-230896.html. The host was compromised at this site through exploitation of Silverlight vulnerabilities described in CVE-2013-0074 and CVE-2013-3896. The successful execution of the exploit code caused the victim to download an RC4-encrypted malware binary installation program.

The second compromised host was redirected to this site while visiting the web forum http://www.thebassbarn.com/forum/12-dry-dock/335063-not-even-dog-catcher.html. The host was compromised at this site by an unidentified Flash exploit. The successful execution of the exploit code caused the victim to download an RC4-encrypted malware binary installation program.

The third compromised host was redirected to this site while visiting the web forum http://forum.freeadvice.com/consumer-bankruptcy-2/post-petition-defamation-219048.html. The host was compromised at this site by an unidentified Flash exploit. The successful execution of the exploit code caused the victim to download an RC4-encrypted malware binary installation program.
